pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing relinquishment
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.10_0: But since we’re staying here, we look to you for support.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.11_0: If you don’t give to us, then who will?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.13_0: Being pressured by the monks from the group of six, that association gave the prepared robes to them and served the food to the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.14_0: The monks who knew that a meal together with robes had been prepared for the Sangha, but not that the robes had been given to those monks from the group six, said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.15_0: “Gotama, please give the robe-cloth to the Sangha.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.17_0: The robes we had prepared were diverted by the monks from the group of six to themselves.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.18_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.19_0: “How can the monks from the group of six divert to themselves things they know were intended for the Sangha?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.20_0: After criticizing those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.21_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.24_0: “... Foolish men, how can you divert to yourselves things that you know were intended for the Sangha?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.25_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.26_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.27.1_0: ‘If a monk diverts to himself material support that he knows was intended for the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.2_0: an association had prepared a meal together with robes for the Sangha. They said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.3_0: “We wish to offer you a meal and then give you robe-cloth.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.4_0: Then the monks from the group of six went to that charnel ground.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.5_0: They went to that thigh and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.8_0: That robe-cloth is prepared for the Sangha.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.10_0: robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.10_1: even if he just has bath powder, soap, a toothbrush, or a piece of string.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.13_0: If he diverts it to himself, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.14_0: When he gets the sitting-blanket, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.15_0: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.16_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.18_0: ‘Venerables, this thing which I diverted to myself knowing that it was intended for the Sangha is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.19_0: I relinquish them to the Sangha.’ ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.22_0: ‘I give these tonics back to you.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.23.1_0: If it is intended for the Sangha and he perceives it as such, and he diverts it to himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.24_0: If it is intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, and he diverts it to himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.25_0: If it is intended for the Sangha, but he does not perceives it as such, and he diverts it to himself, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.26_0: If he diverts to the Sangha of monks, all is intended for the Sangha, or he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.27_0: If he diverts to an individual, he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.28_0: If he diverts it to an individual, but he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.29_0: If it is not intended for the Sangha, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.30_0: If it is not intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.31_0: If it is not intended for the Sangha, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.33_0: if being asked, “Where may we give?” he says, “Give where your gift goes toward equipment” “... where it goes toward repairs” “... where it will last for a long time” “... where you feel inspired;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.36_0: The tenth rule, the training rule on what is intended, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.37_0: The third sub-chapter on almsbowls is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.40_0: Rainy season, the fifth on a gift;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.43_0: “Venerables, the thirty rules on relinquishment and confession have been recited.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.44_0: In regard to this I will ask you:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.46_0: A second time I ask the Sangha to answer:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.52_0: The chapter on offenses entailing relinquishment is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.53_0: The canonical text on offenses entailing expulsion is finished.
